info.name: Doc [v2.0.0-alpha]
info.description:
This is a Postman Collection for the Lawis API v1.1.0-alpha endpoints.

If you have a question related to the API, you can also discuss it in the developer [community chat](https://.slack...com) (todo) or send email for [help](api@lawis.it).

Unless otherwise specified, the default language used for input and output is Italian.

## Quick Installation

Go to the [Collection](https://t.co/lawis-api-postman) and click `Run in Postman`.

## Authentication

An API Key is required to be sent as part of every request to the Lawis API, in the form of an X-Api-Key request header.

If you don't have an API key, you can easily request one by sending an [email](api@lawis.it).

You can store your API key in an environment variable called `api-key` and this Collection will automatically use it to make API calls.

## Rate Limits (Not implemented yet)

API access rate limits are applied at a per-key basis in unit time. Access to the API using a key is limited to 300 requests per minute. In addition, every API response is accompanied by the following set of headers to identify the status of your consumption.

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `X-RateLimit-Limit` | The maximum number of requests the user can make per minute. |
| `X-RateLimit-Remaining` | The number of remaining requests in the current rate limit window. |
| `X-RateLimit-Reset` | The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds. |

## Tables

Some API inputs depend on the official acronyms used by the Italian government. These acronyms are listed onto this CSV file:

| File | Table Description |
| --- | --- |
| [STAA2.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RaLlYmjqXo2l5mJBs7AJPmkarTd0INY4/view?usp=sharing) | Nations |
| [S2PROV.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RHqyxoPu9YzfeJm0pcHVwti0NYQhM5JH/view?usp=sharing) | Provinces |
| [S2NATGIU.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Z8FIdxHadrxoc3b__s4qAgMcC38HIfOf/view?usp=sharing) | Legal forms |
| [S2LIQ.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/12ndX6CPQBC8HpG3X5xIlfavs0bcPT3zr/view?usp=sharing) | Type of proceeding |
| [S2CAR.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10s8PVmbu8rKmsnxFyjL3Qy8JdBUnPGs_/view?usp=sharing) | Offices or qualifications |
| [RACECLFT.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Il18HHt001_aM6ivA0d-YTYwToZQ-48i/view?usp=sharing) | Turnover classifications |
| [RACECLCP.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a70_c21ON9cffEPQfu0OQc7XyqWfIy1h/view?usp=sharing) | Share capital classifications |
| [RACECLCA.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/14E5YkCTGm-sFJhmFtzHHV-9kwaSyy_CD/view?usp=sharing) | Qualification classification |
| [RACECLAD.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1chmQR_PG1x8yKQewwHhmLnAEfLmHIBi9/view?usp=sharing) | Officer classification class |
| [ATECO07.csv](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11_9BvAiFjhqMBDrE_wUavJI3QLlPJ5CU/view?usp=sharing) | ATECO codes (2007) |

Tax code owner of the returned financial statements (REQUIRED).

**Allowed values**

None

**Default values**

None

Output file format.

**Allowed values**

- `X`: Financial Statement in XBRL format.

- `C_IT`: Financial Statement in CSV format.

- `C_EN`: Financial Statement in CSV format translate in English.

- `C_FR`: Financial Statement in CSV format translate in French.

- `C_DE`: Financial Statement in CSV format translate in German.

**Default values**

- `X`

Management of multiple XBRL documents for the same financial statement.

**Allowed values**

- `S`: Includes all financial statements

- `N`: Does not include

**Default values**

- `N`

Type of financial statement (PDF Format).

**Allowed values**

- `Esercizio`: Individual company data

- `Consolidato`: Individual and group data

**Default values**

- `Esercizio`

Reference year of the financial statement.

**Allowed values**

String date with this format **yyyy**, example `2020`.

**Default values**

None

request.description:
This endpoint returns the confirmation of the start of the procedure to take the budget in PDF format.

To download the file, you need to check (`file/check`) the status of the request and wait for it to be completed.

After checking, if the file is ready, you can download it (`/file/download`).

query.description:
Business Register section. 
To select multiple values ​​add the character `,`.

**Allowed values**

- `A`: Artisan Business

- `B`: Certified Incubators

- `G`: Farm Business

- `L`: Social Business

- `M`: Innovative SME

- `O`: Ordinary

- `P`: Small Business

- `Q`: Alternating School-Work

- `R`: R.E.A.

- `S`: Simple Partnership

- `U`: Innovative Start-Up

- `V`: Professional Partnership

**Default values**

- None

Company status.
To select multiple values ​​add the character `,`.

**Allowed values**

- `T`: All

- `A`: Active

- `I`: Inactive

- `S`: Suspeended

- `C`: Ceased

- `R`: Registered (A+S+I)

**Default values**

- None

Company class

**Allowed values**

- `CAP`: Joint Stock Company

- `PER`: Partnership Companies

- `ALT`: Other Forms

**Default values**

- None

Legal form.
To select multiple values ​​add the character `,`. Max 10.

**Allowed values**

Accepts values in S2NATGIU table.

**Default values**

- None

Province of headquarters.
To select multiple values ​​add the character `,`. Max 15.
Search with OR on set fields: if provinces are set, municipalities and
set postcodes that are part of them will be ignored.

**Allowed values**

Can be used in combination with cap and comune.

**Default values**

- None

Municipality of the headquarters.
To select multiple values ​​add the character `,`. Max 15.
Search with OR on the fields set: if provinces are set, municipalities and set post codes that are part of them will be ignored.

**Allowed values**

Can be used in combination with cap and provincia.

**Default values**

- None

Post code of headquarters.
To select multiple values ​​add the character `,`. Max 15.
Search with OR on the fields set: if provinces are set, any municipalities and
post codes set that form part of them will be ignored.

**Allowed values**

It can be used in combination with provincia and comune.

**Default values**

- None

Description of declared activity. (max 5 words, from 2 to 50 characters).
Alternative to Ateco codes; ignore activity search flags

**Allowed values**

ATECO activity

**Default values**

- None

ATECO codes (2007) (max 10)

**Allowed values**

Accepts values in ATECO07 table.

**Default values**

- None

Search flag on main activity. This indicates that Ateco codes set for the principal activity are to be searched.
To be used in combination with Ateco codes (Boolean function).

**Allowed values**

- `S`: Yes

- `N`: No

**Default values**

- `S`

Search flag on primary activity. Indicate that ateco codes set for the primary activity must be searched.
To be used in combination with Ateco codes (Boolean function).

**Allowed values**

- `S`: Yes

- `N`: No

**Default values**

- `S`

Secondary activity search flag. This indicates that the Ateco codes set for the secondary activity are to be searched.
To be used in combination with Ateco codes (Boolean function).

**Allowed values**

- `S`: Yes

- `N`: No

**Default values**

- `S`

No procedure flag. Alternative to all other insolvency procedure parameters.
If set to YES, it controls all other procedure parameters, which are ignored.

**Allowed values**

- `S`: Yes

- `N`: No

**Default values**

- `N`

Class proceedings flag. Alternative to procedure type.
This is considered if no specific type of procedure is set.

**Allowed values**

- `PCO`: Insolvency proceedings

- `LIQ`: Liquidation

- `ALT`: Other procedures

**Default values**

- None

Type of procedure. Alternative to the insolvency procedure class.
Search with OR on the set values; if the procedure class is also set, this will prevail.

**Allowed values**

Accepts values in S2LIQ table.

**Default values**

- None

Can be used when setting both classification and one or more types of proceeding.

- None

**Allowed values**

Search with OR on set values.

**Allowed values**
